Training

In this study, we made the following assumptions:

  • The quality of the generated fiber tracts is not a part of this evaluation. please accept this as a bundle and evaluate based on added uncertainty visualization.

  • We assume the tumors presented in this study are gliomas.

In practice, visualizing the variation of the whole bundle (multiple tracts) is more clinically relevant.
An interactive 3D view below shows the variations of the fiber bundle. In this case, three levels of variance are represented 25% , 75% , 100% .


You can interact with the 3D view using mouse and use sliders to manipulate the anatomical slices. Radio buttons can be used to show or hide the fiber samples and to select the varince level.
Left Mouse button: Rotate
Scroll: Zoom in/out

25% 75% 100%


Hide fiber samples Show fiber samples
